record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 18, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 18, 2007 -- (Senate - September 17, 2007)

[Page: S11614]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until tomorrow morning at 10 a.m., Tuesday, September 18; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the Republicans controlling the first 30 minutes and the majority controlling the final 30 minutes; that following morning business, the Senate proceed to H.R. 1124, as provided for under a previous order; that on Tuesday, following disposition of H.R. 1124, the Senate stand in recess until 2:15 p.m.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
